text.p: These are some of the main stories in Sofia newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

-- Bulgaria has collected 2.95 million tonnes of wheat this year so far at an average yield of 3.16 tonnes per hectare against 1.76 million tonnes at an yield of 1.85 tonnes per hectare for the same period last year, the Agriculture ministry said.
-- Bulgaria hopes to receive some $800 million credits from the World Bank over the next three years, the bank's resident representative to Sofia Alberto Musalem said.
-- Bulgaria's 1997 tobacco output from this year's crop could top July forecast of 70,000 tonnes, experts at the tobacco state monopolist Bulgartabac Holding said.

-- Nearly one fourth of Bulgaria's 31 operating commercial banks are to hold shareholders' meetings in August and September to raise capital and make changes in their management bodies in line with new central bank requirements, a banker said.

-- Bulgaria's industry ministry said it had sealed seven privatisation deals for stakes in industrial firms worth a total of 1.347 billion levs. Buyers have pledged to invest additional $1.02 million in the firms.

-- Food prices rose by an average of 6.4 percent in the past 10 days, the National Statistics Institute said. Monthly inflation was 3.7 percent in July after 0.8 percent the month before. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
